items.summary: Fix backend Motoko compilation errors in backend/main.mo that can cause deployment to fail, including: (1) ensure the InviteRequest.compareByTimestamp function typechecks and actually returns an Order.Order; (2) add any missing imports used in backend/main.mo (e.g., Nat if Nat.compare is used); and (3) replace any invalid array-sorting usage (e.g., calling .sort on a Motoko array value) with a type-correct approach so getAllInviteRequests returns a sorted [InviteRequest] without compilation errors.

Restore successful full deployment by re-running the standard deploy flow after the backend fixes, and ensure the frontend type bindings remain compatible with the backend Candid interface (regenerate/update frontend declarations/types if required by the build system) so the application builds and deploys end-to-end without errors.
